article.title: VLA Radio Observations of the HST Frontier Fields Cluster Abell 2744: The Discovery of New Radio Relics

multiple_choice_question.text: Which substructure is associated with the \'interloper\' gas cloud?
choices: Southern Core
Northern Core
Northwestern Clump
Western \'Ghost\' Substructure

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the general relationship between the radio contours (cyan) and the X-ray emission (orange)?
choices: The radio contours avoid the regions of strong X-ray emission.
The radio contours roughly follow the distribution of the X-ray emission.
The radio contours are only present in the regions where there is no X-ray emission.
There is no apparent relationship between the radio contours and the X-ray emission.

multiple_choice_question.text: Which statement best describes the integrated radio spectrum of the halo between 325 MHz and 3 GHz?
choices: It is best described by a single power law with a steep spectral index.
It shows a clear steepening at higher frequencies.
It remains unclear whether the spectrum steepens at higher frequencies due to differing low frequency data points.
It shows a clear flattening at higher frequencies.
The relationship between shock Mach number and electron energy distribution slope.
The relationship between compression ratio and spectral index.
The relationship between polarization fraction and viewing angle.
The relationship between shock Mach number and radio injection spectral index.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the dashed line in each panel of Figure 13 represent?
choices: The maximum possible polarization fraction for a radio relic.
The minimum possible polarization fraction for a radio relic.
The observed mean polarization fraction for the corresponding source.
The theoretical polarization fraction for a shock viewed edge-on.
